instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Macbook a2337 sound not working
threads.message:
Hello, I got a MacBook air a2337 with liquid damage; the audio board was damaged, sort and no power, I removed the short, and then I got the MacBook back on
after this sound was gone. I decide to replace the audio board, but the sound is still not working. Speakers are ok.

The motherboard is not corroded or anything.

Any advice for me?

Thanks

threads.title: Macbook a2337 sound not working
threads.message:
Very likely M1 damaged by leakage from PPBUS_AON to some of its audio data lines.
Check diode mode to ground on RIO connector (page 50); compare with good board.

Do you get headphones sound?

threads.title: Macbook a2337 sound not working
threads.message:
I found a line CODEC_WAKE_L  going to U8100.
It looks like a small burn. I am right?
[ATTACH type="full" alt="Screenshot 2022-09-06 11-39-05.png"]60764[/ATTACH]


I do get headphones sound.

threads.title: Macbook a2337 sound not working
threads.message:
You should check and compare diode mode readings, as above explained.
I don't see other reason than the leakage, caused by liquid spill on audio board.
Similar failure has been detected on 01521 and 01958 boards.
